channel.title: [PHP] Social Network Source [PHP]
channel.description:
About a year back, Me and a friend got motivated and influenced to make a social network site after watching the movie "The Social Network" about Facebook.
The site took us about 3 to 4 months to complete, writing the site from scratch. Although its very simple, it does everything a social network would need to do. We even started on a mobile edition that was never completed. Once we released the site, we did nothing to promote it, so only 50 or so people from our school has accounts. Since then, The source was just lying around, so i decided "Why not release it to Mopar?". So here it is, I hope you like it. :)
This site was written in PHP.
Here's a link to the active site (Just to test it out, im taking it down after a week or so once this thread dies) [url=http://fblasite.co.cc/daginith_Social_network/beta/]http://fblasite.co.cc/daginith_Social_network/beta/[/url]
Download the source here: [URL=http://up.ht/yd0fPB]ConnectUS_Social_Network_Source_BY_Daginith.zip - 607 KB[/URL]
Here is the SQL for the database. Just dump it into PHPMyAdmin. Or get it here: http://ompldr.org/vN2Z0dA/socialnetwork.sql [code]SET SQL_MODE="NO_AUTO_VALUE_ON_ZERO";--CREATE TABLE `friends` ( `id` int(11) NOT NULL auto_increment, `friend1` varchar(30) NOT NULL, `friend2` varchar(30) NOT NULL, PRIMARY KEY (`id`)) ENGINE=MyISAM DEFAULT CHARSET=utf8 AUTO_INCREMENT=35 ;CREATE TABLE `messages` ( `id` int(11) NOT NULL auto_increment, `from` varchar(30) NOT NULL, `to` varchar(30) NOT NULL, `message` text NOT NULL, `subject` varchar(50) NOT NULL, `read` int(11) NOT NULL, PRIMARY KEY (`id`)) ENGINE=MyISAM DEFAULT CHARSET=utf8 AUTO_INCREMENT=121 ;--CREATE TABLE `requests` ( `id` int(11) NOT NULL auto_increment, `to` varchar(30) NOT NULL, `from` varchar(30) NOT NULL, `key` varchar(100) NOT NULL, PRIMARY KEY (`id`)) ENGINE=MyISAM DEFAULT CHARSET=utf8 AUTO_INCREMENT=45 ;--CREATE TABLE `status` ( `id` int(11) NOT NULL auto_increment, `user` varchar(30) NOT NULL, `message` text NOT NULL, `date` varchar(30) NOT NULL, `time` varchar(20) NOT NULL, PRIMARY KEY (`id`)) ENGINE=MyISAM DEFAULT CHARSET=utf8 AUTO_INCREMENT=146 ;--CREATE TABLE `status_comments` ( `id` int(11) NOT NULL auto_increment, `status_id` int(11) NOT NULL, `poster` varchar(30) NOT NULL, `message` text NOT NULL, PRIMARY KEY (`id`)) ENGINE=MyISAM DEFAULT CHARSET=utf8 AUTO_INCREMENT=57 ;--CREATE TABLE `users` ( `id` int(11) NOT NULL auto_increment, `first_name` varchar(30) NOT NULL, `last_name` varchar(30) NOT NULL, `username` varchar(50) NOT NULL, `password` varchar(100) NOT NULL, `gender` varchar(10) NOT NULL, `birth_year` int(11) NOT NULL, `birth_month` varchar(15) NOT NULL, `birth_day` int(11) NOT NULL, `avatar` varchar(500) NOT NULL, `description` text NOT NULL, `keywords` text NOT NULL, `online` int(11) NOT NULL, PRIMARY KEY (`id`)) ENGINE=MyISAM DEFAULT CHARSET=utf8 AUTO_INCREMENT=62 ;[/code]
[font=verdana]Here are some pics for ya visual people.[/font][img]http://fblasite.co.cc/daginith_Social_network/beta/p/p1.bmp[/img][img]http://fblasite.co.cc/daginith_Social_network/beta/p/p2.bmp[/img][img]http://fblasite.co.cc/daginith_Social_network/beta/p/p3.bmp[/img][img]http://fblasite.co.cc/daginith_Social_network/beta/p/p4.bmp[/img][img]http://fblasite.co.cc/daginith_Social_network/beta/p/p5.bmp[/img][img]http://fblasite.co.cc/daginith_Social_network/beta/p/p6.bmp[/img][img]http://fblasite.co.cc/daginith_Social_network/beta/p/p7.bmp[/img][img]http://fblasite.co.cc/daginith_Social_network/beta/p/p8.bmp[/img][b][size=4]I Hope Someone finds a use for this, and likes it. [/size][/b][b][size=4]Thx :D [/size][/b][b][size=4]-Daginith[/size][/b]

item.title: [PHP] Social Network Source [PHP]
item.dc:creator: @Daginith Daginith
item.description:
@Daginith wrote:

[quote=“Rodgerwilco, post:10, topic:435865”][quote author=xI c E link=topic=538584.msg3940919#msg3940919 date=1331413713]

private server social network anyone?

That’s actually not a bad idea… then again, status lists basically act like a social network.
[/quote]

Should be able to create your own profile… uplopad your own avatar (like rs character picture) show which servers you play etc etc and comment on status links.[/quote]
Thats a good idea. ;D

I might make that.
Anyone think i should? Btw, this time i’ll make a CSS page

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco

private server social network anyone?
[/quote]

That’s actually not a bad idea… then again, status lists basically act like a social network.[/quote]

Should be able to create your own profile… uplopad your own avatar (like rs character picture) show which servers you play etc etc and comment on status links.

item.title: [PHP] Social Network Source [PHP]
item.dc:creator: @Daginith Daginith
item.description:
@Daginith wrote:

xI c E:

“ConnectUs”, very similar to “ConnectU”.

we noticed that right before we took it down. To be honest i didnt know ‘connectu’ existed before the last week of me hosting it.

The original name was “in the circle” then changed to “the inner circle”
People complained they didnt like those names, so it was changed to ‘connectUS’

Read full topic

item.title: [PHP] Social Network Source [PHP]
item.dc:creator: @Daginith Daginith
item.description:
@Daginith wrote:

[quote="-Nothing, post:4, topic:435865"][quote author=Daginith link=topic=538584.msg3940851#msg3940851 date=1331411205]

This could use a style sheet

Shush. It has a small one that does some basic things (some images, bolding…etc), but when we developed this, we were mainly focused on the programming side.
[/quote]
What’s the point in programming if the site looks like absolute shit and nobody would ever even visit that site?[/quote]
We never really got to the CSS. We just… Stopped.

Read full topic
